meanings.definition: A person who votes in an election.
meanings.sent1: The dedicated votarists lined up early to cast their votes.
meanings.sent2: The community center was filled with votarists eager to participate in the election.
meanings.sent3: The votarists had a friendly competition to see who could vote the fastest.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of democracy, the votarists were the lighthouses guiding the way.
meanings.sent5: The image of the votarists standing in line will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A group of people who regularly participate in voting.
meanings.sent1: Our neighborhood has a strong community of votarists who always show up to vote.
meanings.sent2: The club was formed by a dedicated group of votarists who believe in the power of voting.
meanings.sent3: The votarists organized a potluck after voting to celebrate their civic duty.
meanings.sent4: The forest of votarists grew stronger with each election cycle.
meanings.sent5: The unity among the votarists was palpable as they cast their votes together.

meanings.definition: The act of casting a vote in an election.
meanings.sent1: Participating in the votarists' duty, she cast her vote with pride.
meanings.sent2: The importance of the votarists' role was evident in the act of voting.
meanings.sent3: The votarists' dance troupe performed a routine inspired by the voting process.
meanings.sent4: With each ballot dropped, the sound of democracy echoed among the votarists.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of the votarists' action held the power to shape the future.
